event: First European exploration by Spanish
Dutch establish first permanent trading post
British capture Dutch colonies during Napoleonic Wars
Dutch formally cede Guyana to Britain
Formation of British Guiana by unifying Dutch colonies
Abolition of slavery in British Empire
Indentured laborers from India begin arriving
Border dispute with Venezuela begins
New British constitution imposed, reducing local autonomy
First elections under universal suffrage; British suspend constitution
Cheddi Jagan becomes premier under self-government
Guyana gains independence from Britain on May 26
Declared a Cooperative Republic under Forbes Burnham
Jonestown Massacre: 918 people die in mass murder-suicide
New constitution creates executive presidency
Desmond Hoyte becomes president after Burnham’s death
Cheddi Jagan wins first free and fair election
Janet Jagan becomes Guyana’s first female president
David Granger elected president, ending PPP's long rule
Irfaan Ali becomes president after disputed election
Guyana experiences rapid economic growth due to offshore oil production
